newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MTBE steady but strong, outlook bullish.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MTBE steady but strong, outlook bullish.

text.p: U.S. spot MTBE prices remained largely steady on Friday amid tight supply on prompt barrels and following news a U.S. House panel killed the ethanol subsidy.
On Thursday, the House tax writing panel narrowly defeated a measure to preserve the 54 cents a gallon tax incentive on ethanol, which competes with MTBE as an octane enhancer.
"This is just a step," said a MTBE trader based in Houston. "We won't react until any cut in the subsidy is signed by Congress."

Meanwhile, continued buying in the U.S. Gulf Coast to load a 260,000 barrel cargo for New York Harbor kept prices at 80.00/80.25 cents a gallon. The boat began loading late last week and caused a nearly two cent jump in the market.
Another player was heard loading a large number of barrels in the Gulf for the West Coast after finding cheap freight rates aboard a mix-used vessel, traders said.
The demand has tightened the supply of prompt barrels, and the outlook for prices appears to remain bullish in the near term.

Traders and analysts predict a drop in imports this month into the harbor partly due to turnaround at Arco's MTBE facility in Rotterdam. This Saturday, Venezuela's 12,500 barrel-per-day plant in Jose, Venezuela, will also go down for turnaround to change a catalyst. It will be out until June 28.
The facility, which is a joint venture with Echo Fuels, exported much of its product to the West Coast, traders said.
Harbor spot MTBE was pegged a half cent stronger, with offers at 83.25 cents.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
